statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 3 \\ 13 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -9 \\ 12 \\ 28 \\ 12 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 3 \\ 13 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -9 \\ 12 \\ 28 \\ 12 \end{array}\right].
